intro: Gilia caespitosa, commonly known as blue gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Gilia caespitosa is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
